trans-unit.source: Connects a local device to a network resource

seg-source.mrk: Connects a local device to a network resource

target.mrk: Connects a local device to a network resource

trans-unit.source: Parameters

seg-source.mrk: Parameters

target.mrk: Parameters

trans-unit.source: Name of a local device to be redirected, such as "F:" or "LPT1".

seg-source.mrk: Name of a local device to be redirected, such as "F:" or "LPT1".

target.mrk: Name of a local device to be redirected, such as "F:" or "LPT1".

trans-unit.source: The string is treated in a case-insensitive manner.

seg-source.mrk: The string is treated in a case-insensitive manner.

target.mrk: The string is treated in a case-insensitive manner.

trans-unit.source: If the Null keyword or an empty, a connection to the network resource is made without redirecting the local device.

seg-source.mrk: If the Null keyword or an empty, a connection to the network resource is made without redirecting the local device.

target.mrk: If the Null keyword or an empty, a connection to the network resource is made without redirecting the local device.

trans-unit.source: Name of the network resource to connect to

seg-source.mrk: Name of the network resource to connect to

target.mrk: Name of the network resource to connect to

trans-unit.source: [optional] Password to be used to make a connection.

seg-source.mrk: [optional]
Password to be used to make a connection.

target.mrk: [optional]
Password to be used to make a connection.

trans-unit.source: This parameter is usually the password associated with the current user.

seg-source.mrk: This parameter is usually the password associated with the current user.

target.mrk: This parameter is usually the password associated with the current user.

trans-unit.source: If 0, the default password is used.

seg-source.mrk: If 0, the default password is used.

target.mrk: If 0, the default password is used.

trans-unit.source: If the string is empty, no password is used.

seg-source.mrk: If the string is empty, no password is used.

target.mrk: If the string is empty, no password is used.

trans-unit.source: Return Value

seg-source.mrk: Return Value

target.mrk: Return Value

trans-unit.source: True.

seg-source.mrk: True.

target.mrk: True.

trans-unit.source: False.

seg-source.mrk: False.

target.mrk: False.

trans-unit.source: Remarks

seg-source.mrk: Remarks

target.mrk: Remarks

trans-unit.source: This function is provided only for compatibility with 16-bit versions of Windows.

seg-source.mrk: This function is provided only for compatibility with 16-bit versions of Windows.

target.mrk: This function is provided only for compatibility with 16-bit versions of Windows.

trans-unit.source: Applications should call the _WinNet_AddConnection2() or the _WinNet_AddConnection3() function.

seg-source.mrk: Applications should call the _WinNet_AddConnection2() or the _WinNet_AddConnection3() function.

target.mrk: Applications should call the _WinNet_AddConnection2() or the _WinNet_AddConnection3() function.

trans-unit.source: A successful connection is persistent meaning that the system automatically restores the connection during subsequent logon operations.

seg-source.mrk: A successful connection is persistent meaning that the system automatically restores the connection during subsequent logon operations.

target.mrk: A successful connection is persistent meaning that the system automatically restores the connection during subsequent logon operations.
